I think that Minecraft Bedrock Edition should look exactly like the Console Legacy Edition, but with the new Minecraft Texture. And on the Console Legacy Edition, you can read texts on signs more clearly, but on the Bedrock Edition, you can barely read texts on signs far away and you have to look very close to the screen just to be able to read it. So I would like that problem to be solved so you can read it better

And I would also like Minecraft Bedrock Editon to have the same controls and features as the Console Legacy Edition such as moving forward in a straight line whenever you fly in the air and stay still whenever you're underwater in fly mode. And I would also like that taken care of. Thank you! #minecraftplayerforever

I have an idea for a command that does the same thing as setblock but it's: setblockarea that does the same thing but it needs 4 coordinates so it can fill in that area with that block and the corners. So then it saves a lot of command blocks just fill in a big area or remove a big area.
So would it just fill out all caves nearby? How does it show overlapping caves? In different shades/colors?
It would fill out as you explore the cave. Not every surrounding cave. Just what you explore.
What if you explore overlapping caves?
Map would only map out what you explore. You would need to create a new map for every cave.

Excuse me, how hard do you think pistons are to get? Really not that hard, especially with Iron farms and giant Iron Veins. Redstone is also extremely abundant. You can absolutely get at least a few pistons, if not a multitude, early game. I like the concept behind Amethyst being something you have to always go back to and do yourself, much like spawners. But the true problem is how incredibly slow they can get. It's not fun having to go through the effort of finding and excavating one and going back to it each time IF you still have to wait literal hours just for a couple of stacks of a material that isn't that useful anyways, especially when the few uses it has demand it in large amounts. I think it really should get buffed; spending more time doing things can be fun and/or balancing, but just waiting extensively for things to happen without doing anything objectively isn't. It should take time, just not that much; it's not like it's the most powerful or game-breaking item anyway, so really I don't see any issue with being able to get more faster. But I do think the gameplay design should stay as is; people are finally required to be manually/actively engaged with something to obtain it. A bit of a break from the "I control every single item and have it delivered to my base" madness. If they are moveable with pistons, people will instantly start moving them closer to their bases, lining them up and connecting them to automatic item farms and sorters; it defeats the point.
This would be a good compromise with not being able to pick them up.  Not needing a bunch of scaffolding to collect them would be great.
The point of the geodes is you build the farm around them and you have to find them, you can’t move a spawner and you can’t move the geodes
